intro: Wittmackia altocaririensis, commonly known as the Altocaririensis bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in areas with mild, humid climates. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms during the spring and early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
